You're both right, sort of. Cho's ult scales with only _bonus_ health, and Stoneplate used to increase your max health by 40/100% of your current health. This was all given as bonus health. 

The way it works now is it gives you 40/100% of your _base_ health as _base_ health and 40/100% of your _bonus_ health as _bonus_ health. This is a bunch of fancy numbers that means nothing in most cases _except for bonus health scalings_.

Ex. 
Before: If you had 1500 base health and 1500 bonus health (3000 total), activating Stoneplate with 3 enemies around would give you 3000 _bonus_ health, increasing Cho's ult damage by an extra 300.

After: If you had 1500 base health and 1500 bonus health (3000 total), activating Stoneplate with 3 enemies around you gives 1500 more _base_ health and 1500 more _bonus_ health. This only increases Cho's ult damage by an extra 150 instead of 300. 

Result is you still get the same amount of health out of activating Stoneplate, but it helps curb it's effectiveness for bonus health scalings.

Turrets have had a lot going against them for a while. Even though they haven't faced too many direct nerfs, the rest of the game has power creeped around them. AD items get 5 or 10 extra points here and there, new champions with instantly proccable shields and untargetability keep getting added, minions start automatically pushing waves, tank items get higher armor coupled with very slow turret damage ramp up making dives occur as early as level 2 with no real consequence or precision required. Turret stats increase only with time, while games have become shorter and levels gained quicker, making them not scale as quickly as the champions or even the minions in-game.

At this point turrets are glorified caster minions that exist only to give the opposing team gold and steal CS from the automatically pushing waves.

The nexus turrets offer a small bit of potential, having regenerating health after not being attacked for long enough, but  the structures need a lot of improvements to catch up to where everything else in the game as come to.
